revised_title: Meteorological Observations on Board Her Majesty's Expedition
tldr: This article presents meteorological observations made during an expedition to complete magnetical observations in high southern latitudes. The observations include daily measurements of barometer, temperature, wind direction, and weather conditions. The results are compared with previous observations and conclusions drawn from Dr. Adolph Erman's work, showing agreement in the placement of maximum barometric pressure in lat. 35°.
